intro: Corallodendron brucei, commonly known as the Bruce's coral tree, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Bignoniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive coral-like inflorescences. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces showy, orange to yellow flowers. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in dry forests and scrublands. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
